snippet: The United Nations report described horrors committed “on a massive scale,” and it is likely to boost calls for sanctions, which the United States has begun.
abstract: United Nations issues report describing horrors committed by both sides in the civil war in South Sudan; account, likely to boost calls for sanctions, documents crimes against humanity, including arbitrary killings and attacks on churches, hospital and international aid facilities.

byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Bentiu, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations report described horrors committed “on a massive scale,” and it is likely to boost calls for sanctions, which the United States has begun.

headline.main: U.N. Report Documents Atrocities by Both Sides in South Sudan War
headline.print_headline: U.N. Report Documents Atrocities by Both Sides in South Sudan War

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
